verses.text: O give thanks to the LORD; for \add he is\add* good: because his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
Let Israel now say, that his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, \add and set me\add* in a large place.
The LORD \add is\add* on my side; I will not fear: what can man do to me?
The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see \add my desire\add* upon them that hate me.
\add It is\add* better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
\add It is\add* better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
All nations encompassed me: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.
They encompassed me; yes, they encompassed me: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
They encompassed me like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
Thou hast violently thrust at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.
The LORD \add is\add* my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
The voice of rejoicing and salvation \add is\add* in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.
The LORD hath chastened me severely: but he hath not given me over to death.
Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will enter them, \add and\add* I will praise the LORD:
This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.
I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.
The stone \add which\add* the builders refused is become the head \add stone\add* of the corner.
This is the LORD'S doing; it \add is\add* wonderful in our eyes.
This \add is\add* the day \add which\add* the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.
Blessed \add be\add* he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.
God \add is\add* the LORD, who hath shown us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, \add even\add* to the horns of the altar.
Thou \add art\add* my God, and I will praise thee: \add thou art\add* my God, I will exalt thee.
O give thanks to the LORD; for \add he is\add* good: for his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
